reviews.text: The whole stay from when we arrived at the Aberdaire country club for lunch, the drive to the Ark, the food and accommodation (the hot water bottle was a nice touch, even though it wasn't cold) and the drive back in the morning was great. The fact that you could see the animals so close up was ideal for us and the bells in the rooms to inform you of animals visiting during the night was good. The Hide was the best place of all. There was a problem with the hot water but it didn't spoil the stay. The only sad thing that happened was that a man didn't get the full benefit of the place because he was on his phone and laptop all afternoon and evening. I thought holidays were too get away from work. A most place too go if you are animal lovers
reviews.title: Fantastic if you want to see wild animals close up in their natural environment

reviews.text: From the poor reviews I had previously read about The Ark, I wasn't sure really what to expect. But I can safely say that after visiting there, it was out of all the places I stayed in the 2 week period(4-5 different Sarova hotels and the White Sands), by far my favorite!! Ok sure, it's not a Sarova hotel, but the experience of being so far out in the middle of the green forrest just above a watering hole is not something your going to see anywhere else! The rooms are not that small, the beds are comfy, and there's hot water. The whole point of being there is to see the wildlife, not be in your rooms the whole time. You'll be outside or in other viewing rooms watching these animals practically walk right past you. The people are SO nice and welcoming. They will sit and tell you some pretty amazing stories too. I loved everything about The Ark, and I wish I could have stayed there longer. If you want to experience the wild, then I definitely suggest this. It's something you can only experience in Kenya. It was beautiful! If i ever go back, I will definitely go back here.
reviews.title: Unique and beautiful experience- a must see!

reviews.text: By far, the poorest accommodations on our two week safari in Kenya. I've stayed in many Fairmont Hotels while on business in North America, so was expecting a well maintained, plush hotel. It's a dump. The common areas are ok, but the rooms are disgusting. Nasty, yellowish, brownish, stinky water in the bathroom. Really narrow beds. Peeling, rotten and dirty carpeting that would not have been nice even when it was new. Walls were rough chip wood painted a dark brown that had a foul odor to it. I hated every moment I had to spend there. I finally fell asleep, but awoke screaming as I had a bad dream. Not something I’m accustomed to.
reviews.title: Skip the Ark...it's very disappointing

reviews.text: The food was horrible both at the Abedare Country Club and the Ark. The cook did not know how to cook meat. At lunch I had the steak which was full of fat and gristle and over cooked to boot. I didn't eat any of it. For dinner I ordered the lamb. Don't know how it was cooked so badly that I couldn't chew it. Terrible. I consider myself a good cook and have no idea how you could cook meat so badly. I couldn’t do that if I tried!
Also, was perplexed by the playing of North American Country / Western Music? We didn't go all the way to Africa to listen to that! How about some African music?

reviews.text: Perched on top of a hill overlooking a valley and a watering hole in the Aberdare ranges, The Ark was a very new and completely different experience for us. Its wide terraces afforded excellent view of the wildlife from cosy comforts; the photographer's den let me shoot the elephants and the hyenas from just a few feet away. The animals were ever present at the watering hole and we could have sat watching them the whole night. Hot tea, coffee, milk and chocolate round the clock were very welcome. It is very cold out there.
reviews.title: Awesome Wildlife Viewing

reviews.text: The cabins are tiny, fashioned after old ship cabins. But are very cosy and afford great sleep. The Ark has an ingenious system of bell signals in every room to alert the sighting of animals in the night. The staff is excellent. Our guide had great sense of humour too.
reviews.title: Un9ique hotel with plenty of animal viewing

reviews.text: The base camp for the Ark, the country club, is no less great a place. Very richly appointed in the old British sense, the place overlooks a huge expanse of plane. It is very well landscaped with beautiful flowers and very varied fauna. The place has a tennis court and a swimming pool too. It is a good idea to spend a few days in the quiet of the country club and a few nights of wildlife sighting at the Ark.
